page.title: 09Sandwich Railway Station
page.content: Until recently,Sandwich Railway Station has had the appearance of an old coal shed with dirty waiting rooms and its window frames falling apart.Weeds grew on the line and the bridge across the line was rusty. However,a miraculous change has taken place,mainly for safety reasons but also for appearance and efficiency.The wooden manual gates have been replaced by automatic barriers and closed circuit cameras monitoring pedestrian movement. The waiting rooms have been renovated and have had a new coat of paint,the weeds have been uprooted and the bridge has been completely repaired. Although other Railway Stations are more important,British Rail has spent {100,000 on a face-lift for the 1985 114th British Open Golf Tournament to welcome spectators arriving by train.
